text:
THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
TELECOMMUNICATIONS CENTER
Richard B. Hull, Executive Director
MS s °
t.
August 28, 1961
WUHam Harley, President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Bill:
WOSU TELEVISION
2470 North Star Road
Columbus 21, Ohio
As Harold Hill will have indicated, 1 called today to report that
the letter you and I discussed for some reason has not arrived and
also to note the possible switch in signals on the Robert*s bill
which Lennie Harks indicated might now be proper strategy. I added
a reaction I had to the NAEB press release for the JCEB session
August 30 which he will report. A fine statement, I thought. My
"editorial comment" was only in response to what I thought might
be policy overtones.
Good to see you. Thanks for the ride to the airport. Good old
United was ten minutes late departing so I had even more margin
than I thought.
Sincerely,
P.S. Since this letter was dictated, your letter dated August 23rd
was received. Have also mentioned this in a letter to Harold
that some of your staff use the address of the radio station,
215 W. 19th Ave. This delays our mail for one day—if it is
sent to 2470 N. Star Road, Columbus 21, one of the middlemen isy
eliminated and we get prompt service.
Teaching Aids Laboratory • Office o) Seminars and Workshops • Ohio School of the Air • Video Recording • WOSU—WOSU-FM—WOSU-TV • Closed Circuit TV
